name: GetProjectAllocations
description:
Retrieve allocations for a specific project, user, or placeholder.

Use this tool to get a list of work allocations filtered by a specific project, user, or placeholder in Asana.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the project to filter allocations by.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the project to filter allocations by.

parameters.name: assignee_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the user or placeholder the allocation is assigned to.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the user or placeholder the allocation is assigned to.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace to filter allocations by.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of allocations to return per page, between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset token for pagination. Use this to retrieve the next page of results. If not provided, the first page will be returned. Only use offsets returned from previous requests.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: List properties to include in the response, provided as a list of strings. Provides access to additional data fields.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable pretty output format for JSON. Use this for easier reading during debugging, as it increases response size and processing time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.
